oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John A. Crutchfield to Mrs. L. M. Crutchfield describing Forrest's 1864 actions in Mississippi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from 1st Lt. John A. Crutchfield, Co. F, 20th (Russell's) Tenn. Cav. Regt., part of Nathan Bedford Forrest's command in northern Mississippi describing recent battle (Battle of Harrisburg?) in Mississippi and his unit's losses. Crutchfield conveys that the reports of Col. Falken being killed were false. "He was wounded badly though not killed."
